byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and MICHAEL WINERIP

abstract: Kalief Browder, whose imprisonment and two years of solitary confinement at Rikers Island drew attention to dysfunction in New York City prison system, commits suicide at his parents' home in Bronx; 22-year-old Browder reportedly had difficulty recovering from fears developed in prison and from solitary confinement.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Browder, 22, who spent two of the years in solitary confinement, drew the attention of Bill de Blasio, Rand Paul and other public figures after he was written about last year in The New Yorker.

headline.main: Kalief Browder, Held at Rikers Island for 3 Years Without Trial, Commits Suicide
headline.print_headline: Man Held at Rikers Jail for 3 Years Without Trial Commits Suicide at 22

snippet: Mr. Browder, 22, who spent two of the years in solitary confinement, drew the attention of Bill de Blasio, Rand Paul and other public figures after he was written about last year in The New Yorker.
